case_name: Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization
summary: Overturned Roe v. Wade, holding that the Constitution does not confer a right to abortion.

case_name: New York State Rifle & Pistol Association v. Bruen
summary: Struck down New York's concealed carry law, expanding Second Amendment rights.
Limited EPA's authority to regulate carbon emissions under the Clean Air Act.

case_name: Students for Fair Admissions v. Harvard
summary: Struck down race-based affirmative action in college admissions.
Held that a website designer could refuse to create websites for same-sex weddings based on free speech.
Upheld federal law prohibiting gun possession by people subject to domestic violence restraining orders.
Overturned Chevron deference, requiring courts to interpret statutes independently.
Held that presidents have absolute immunity for official acts.
Upheld one-time tax on foreign earnings, rejecting challenge under Appointments Clause.
Held that cities can enforce anti-camping ordinances without violating Eighth Amendment.
Struck down student loan forgiveness program.
Held that true threats require proof of subjective intent.
Clarified standard for religious accommodation under Title VII.
Held that a coach's prayer was protected by the Free Exercise Clause.
Held that states cannot exclude religious schools from tuition assistance programs.
Held that Philadelphia violated Free Exercise Clause by excluding Catholic adoption agency.
Upheld Arizona voting restrictions.

case_name: Mahanoy Area School District v. B.L.
summary: Held that school could not discipline student for off-campus social media posts.
Held that challengers lacked standing to challenge individual mandate.
Held that Title VII prohibits discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity.

case_name: Department of Homeland Security v. Regents of the University of California
summary: Held that DACA rescission was arbitrary and capricious.

case_name: Espinoza v. Montana Department of Revenue
summary: Held that states cannot exclude religious schools from scholarship programs.
Struck down Louisiana abortion law.
Held that partisan gerrymandering claims are nonjusticiable.

case_name: Department of Commerce v. New York
summary: Blocked addition of citizenship question to census.
Narrowed but did not overrule Auer deference.
Held that mandatory union fees violate First Amendment.

case_name: Masterpiece Cakeshop v. Colorado Civil Rights Commission
summary: Held that commission showed hostility to religious beliefs.
Overturned physical presence requirement for sales tax.
Upheld travel ban.
Held that immigration removal provision was unconstitutionally vague.
Struck down Texas abortion restrictions.
Upheld affirmative action program.
Held that discovery of outstanding warrant attenuated taint of illegal stop.
Held that same-sex couples have fundamental right to marry.
Held that tax credits available in all states.

case_name: Arizona State Legislature v. Arizona Independent Redistricting Commission
summary: Held that independent commission did not violate Elections Clause.
Held 5-4 that state exhaustion requirements cannot immunize officials from ยง 1983 claims challenging administrative delays. Created catch-22 rule.
